I can’t wait to write an essay about my survival course experience where I can further unpack and process more about what it means to be “free” in America.

In some ways I felt safer hiking on the side of a canyon two hours out from Prescott in the wilderness. I saw a “Black Guns Matter” sticker leaving the literally one-room Prescott airport. Inside the red heart of this sign it reads “Guns Save Lives”. https://t.co/r4N5XPGlmc

I saw a skunk, a snake, a large black spider, a hawk, lots of song birds, tarantula hawks, and scorpions. I carved a bow drill set by hand to make fire. I made a drinking gourd and finger weaved the straps for it by hand. I did all of the wood work myself including this spoon! https://t.co/ZbtRIMfIQV

For 9 days I’ve had no phone, no internet, no watch, no toilet paper, no running water or electricity, no tent, no sleeping bag. Verde River rocks were my toilet paper. Most nights I slept under a juniper tree with just two wool blankets. I ate a blue grasshopper and cattails.

I’m back!
